Description: Vue de l'intérieur de la Mosqée de St Athanase, study for the lower image of Plate 9 in the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; interior courtyard of the mosque, a small domed building at centre, palm trees and figures Graphite, with grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Victor Pillement. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
Acquisition notes: The Denon Egyptian campaign drawings in the BM were lots 892 and 893 (pp. 204-205) in the posthumous Denon sale held in Paris in 1826. The lots were offered together and were unsold at 1000 francs.
